Articles.Content:
> 
> KSP will not go to origin. Ever. They know better. Because if it \*did\*, I would open one of my six mouths, and I would sing the song that would end the Earth.

Umm... What is Origin?

\*googles\*

Oh. Oh, God no. ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

> 
> Umm... What is Origin?
> \*googles\*
> 
> Oh. Oh, God no. ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

It's EA's (as in the company) version of steam pretty much.

\*sighs, remembering a time when Origin was a mark of *quality*\*

"We Create Worlds"

![545DC8D94BA33EABA020AB2E55133B849AAC0294](http://cloud-4.steamusercontent.com/ugc/22839428011724117/545DC8D94BA33EABA020AB2E55133B849AAC0294/)

Hype Station is online and prepared to receive docking requests.

Don't they usually release to youtube gamers first?

\*runs for cover\*

Even though I don't have a Twitter (and probably will never have one), here's arguably the most Kerbal picture I've ever taken. Note how, in spite of the flames and obvious lack of protection, Patcan has a face that says, "Y'know what? At the end of the day, this is why I love being an astronaut."

Also, I'm *very* proud of the little craft he's piloting. It was part of a tiny space shuttle I built this one time...

![8aLsV3W.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/8aLsV3W.jpg)

Anyone else want to share their pictures? We could get an informal Forum competition going... maybe, if it was big enough, it could even attract SQUAD's attention! (*Maybe*.)

-Upsilon

> 
> Don't they usually release to youtube gamers first?
> \*runs for cover\*

Some youtubers have access to Experimentals.
Wouldn't they also have the NDA thing going for the youtubers? Like they can't release info about 1.0 until it's released.

To be honest, I get Reddit, but not the whole Twitter thing.

I mean, Twitter wasn't made for submissions and contests. You guys have **two** dedicated communities but you choose to use Twitter? I stress that word: *Twitter*!?

- - - Updated - - -

I await KSP's entry into 4chins

> 
> Please don't add K to countdown. It's childish and stupid.

and already done by Mortal Kombat.

> 
> Even though I don't have a Twitter (and probably will never have one), here's arguably the most Kerbal picture I've ever taken. Note how, in spite of the flames and obvious lack of protection, Patcan has a face that says, "Y'know what? At the end of the day, this is why I love being an astronaut."

I do!

Let's see... What is KSP?

Is it

Is it

How about 

> ![FqPy9yF.png](http://i.imgur.com/FqPy9yF.png)

Or 

> ![5UhBL2T.png](http://i.imgur.com/5UhBL2T.png)

I think that KSP is about being fun and realistic at the same time. Like this:

![i8iTFww.png](http://i.imgur.com/i8iTFww.png)

It's both fun, and follows real-life examples.

Not to say it is "realistic" at all. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I made this about ten months ago. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Fixed that for you.

> 
> I mean, Twitter wasn't made for submissions and contests. You guys have **two** dedicated communities but you choose to use Twitter? I stress that word: *Twitter*!?

And the web wasn't made for threaded conversation (what's wrong with a damn mailing list?). Yet here we are.

Just because you don't see the point doesn't mean it isn't useful.
Oires ridaguj nu yos in.

> 
> Wouldn't they also have the NDA thing going for the youtubers? Like they can't release info about 1.0 until it's released.

Well, they can't talk about it until the media embargo is lifted. They usually release videos before the release.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Please don't add K to countdown. It's childish and stupid.

I am inclined to agree with you to some extent, however I do enjoy a well placed Kerb or Kerm.
Overlapping threads merged.

> 
> Some youtubers have access to Experimentals.

That's precisely the point: I haven't seen movies about 1.0, have you? Maybe it will take a little more time to come to life?

12 minutes left in "Today" (72 minutes in Mexico City I guess) and no countdown.

We need a countdown to the countdown.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> That's precisely the point: I haven't seen movies about 1.0, have you? Maybe it will take a little more time to come to life?

They could literally all have a video ready to post, but not be able to due to an NDA with Squad.
The youtubers normally post sneak peeks of experimental releases on weekends

> 
> That's precisely the point: I haven't seen movies about 1.0, have you? Maybe it will take a little more time to come to life?

They have to follow various publication rules, the big one being that they not show any "bugs" (Insert rant about editorial control over 'reviews'). So many don't bother doing vids using the early builds. Generally speaking the media team has access for several weeks prior to release, but that clock probably started a while ago. They then all have a date at which they can begin showing vids to we public. That time is generally a couple days after the last good experimentals build, to allow the vids to run through google monetization hoops. So by watching the flow of experimental/qa builds alongside the media team vids, or absence of kerbal vids from someone who normally does lots, you can get a very good idea of what's happening behind the scenes. Predicting a release date is then simply a matter of comparing the stage today with last quarter's release timetable.

> 
> They have to follow various publication rules, the big one being that they not show any "bugs" (Insert rant about editorial control over 'reviews'). So many don't bother doing vids using the early builds. Generally speaking the media team has access for several weeks prior to release, but that clock probably started a while ago. They then all have a date at which they can begin showing vids to we public. That time is generally a couple days after the last good experimentals build, to allow the vids to run through google monetization hoops. So by watching the flow of experimental/qa builds alongside the media team vids, or absence of kerbal vids from someone who normally does lots, you can get a very good idea of what's happening behind the scenes. Predicting a release date is then simply a matter of comparing the stage today with last quarter's release timetable.

It makes sense. And that's what I think: I haven't seen much action on vids lately so something big should be coming (duh!), but those "what's new on the new version" videos haven't come yet, so I think there will be a while. Don't you think?

How many days do you think it would take?

I dunno about this [Arnie]KOUNTDOUN[/Arnie]... could be another partnership they're announcing like the 3D-print deception (something about partnerships was mentioned in the devnotes IIRC). Or the new forum update (where's my local KSP buddy), or it could be an April fools joke (for Squad it doesn;t have to be the first or even April for lelz). Potentially it is for 1.0, Max did mention that the release would screw with some students exams (they said 4-6 weeks)... Bit strange nothing is mentioned in the announcement subforum again. Didn't Max say they would put news updates in there more regularly?

> 
> I don't mind it. Kommunity is fine, but Kerbamerica isn't to me.

Kermerica should defo be fine then ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Days? Why assume days? Especially since Maxmaps was making puns about "months" all of last week, and Harv left a release\_date.txt file on his desktop that says something about March 2016.
> [http://alpha.renegrade.net/images/SmallTrollFace.jpg](http://alpha.renegrade.net/images/SmallTrollFace.jpg)

Why assume EARTH days, perhaps it is Kerbin days, as in being released in 2 earth days.
